SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.omancode.r
Class RFace

java.lang.Object
  org.omancode.r.RFace

public final class RFace
extends Object

General purpose interface to the R high level engine. Provides

  • Single instance static interface to R (because R is single threaded).
  • Load and initialise functions.
  • Multiple methods for evaluating R expressions including with/without output of returned expressions or printed output, and with/without exception handling.
  • Evaluation of expressions from files.
  • Assignment of R objects.
  • Message output to the R console.
Uses the RServe REngine interface, which prevents re-entrance and has Java side objects that represent R data structures, rather than the lower level JRI Rengine interface which doesn't have these features.

Version:
$Revision: 56 $
Author:
Oliver Mannion

eval

public REXP eval(String expr)
          throws RFaceException
Evaluate an expression in R in the global environment. Does not explicitly call "parse" so any syntax errors will result in the unhelpful "parse error" exception message. Any evaluation errors will have the error messages printed to the console and return the exception message "error during evaluation". Unlike, the REPL and parseEvalPrint(String), does not print the result of the expression (ie: does just the E part of the REPL). Any prints within the expression or functions called by the expression will print. Warnings produced by the expression will not be printed (instead they will appear next time a command is entered directly into the REPL and executed).

Parameters:
expr - expression to evaluate.
Returns:
REXP result of the evaluation. Not printed to the console.
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem during parse or evaluation. Parse errors will simply return the message "parse error". Any evaluation errors with have the error messages printed to the console and return the exception message "error during evaluation".

evalReturnStrings

                           throws RFaceException
Evaluate an expression and test that it returns a REXPString.

Parameters:
expr - expression to evaluate.
Returns:
String array or null.
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem during parse or evaluation, or expression does not return a REXPString.

evalReturnNamedStrings

public Map<String,String> evalReturnNamedStrings(String expr)
                                          throws RFaceException
Evaluate an expression, testing that it returns a REXPString, and return a map with keys equal to the names of the character vector and values equal to the vector values. If the expression returns a REXPNull then an empty map is returned.

Parameters:
expr - expression to evaluate.
Returns:
map of named strings
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem during parse or evaluation, or expression does not return a REXPString.

evalReturnNamedStrings

public Map<String,String> evalReturnNamedStrings(String expr,
                                                 Map<String,String> map)
                                          throws RFaceException
Evaluate an expression, testing that it returns a REXPString, and return a map with keys equal to the names of the character vector and values equal to the vector values. If the expression returns a REXPNull then an empty map is returned.

Parameters:
expr - expression to evaluate.
map - to fill with strings
Returns:
map of named strings
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem during parse or evaluation, or expression does not return a REXPString.

evalCaptureOutput

public String evalCaptureOutput(String expr)
                         throws RFaceException
Evaluate a String expression in R in the global environment. Returns all console output produced by this evaluation. Does not return the REXP produced by the evaluation. This is needed for functions like str which print their output and don't return anything.

Parameters:
expr - expression to evaluate.
Returns:
console output from the evaluation.
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem during parse or evaluation. Parse errors will simply return the message "parse error".

evalReturnString

public String evalReturnString(String expr)
                        throws RFaceException
Evaluate an expression and test that it returns a REXPString. Return the character vector as one String with newlines between elements.

Parameters:
expr - expression to evaluate.
Returns:
String with newlines between elements, or null if expr returns null.
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem during parse or evaluation, or expression does not return a REXPString.

parseEvalTryAsRList

public RList parseEvalTryAsRList(String expr)
                          throws RFaceException
parseEvalTry(String) that returns an RList or exception.

Parameters:
expr - expression to try and parse and eval
Returns:
rlist, or null if expr returns REXPNull.
Throws:
RFaceException - if expr does not return a list

parseEvalTry

public REXP parseEvalTry(String expr)
                  throws RFaceException
Wraps a parse and try around an eval. The parse will generate syntax error messages, and the try will catch parse and evaluation errors and return them in the exception as opposed to printing it on the console.

Parameters:
expr - expression to try and parse and eval
Returns:
REXP result of the evaluation.
Throws:
RFaceException - if there is a parse or evaluation error the error message is returned in the exception. Nothing printed to the console.

parseEvalTry

public REXP parseEvalTry(String expr,
                         boolean silent)
                  throws RFaceException
Wraps a parse and try around an eval. The parse will generate syntax error messages, and the try will catch parse and evaluation errors and return them in the exception.

Parameters:
expr - expression to try and parse and eval
silent - if true will not print anything to the console, otherwise error and warning messages will be displayed on the console
Returns:
REXP result of the evaluation.
Throws:
RFaceException - if there is a parse or evaluation error the error message is returned in the exception. Nothing printed to the console.

                                  throws RFaceException
Evaluate expr returning a RMatrix or any errors as an RFaceException.

Parameters:
expr - expression
Returns:
RMatrix
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem evaluating expr, including if expr does not return an expression that can be represented as a RMatrix.

parseEvalTryReturnNamedNumber

public NamedNumber[] parseEvalTryReturnNamedNumber(String expr)
                                            throws RFaceException
Evaluates expr and returns an array of NamedNumber.

Parameters:
expr - expression
Returns:
named number array
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem evaluating expr, including if expr does not return a REXPDouble or REXPInteger.

parseEvalPrint

public REXP parseEvalPrint(String expr)
Wraps a parse around an eval and prints (shows) result. Returns the expression result AND prints it to the console if it is visible, ie: the REP parts of the REPL. Errors & warnings are output to the console, ie: doesn't produce Java exceptions for expression errors. Uses R global environment. Since the complete expression is parsed before any of it is run, syntax errors result in none of the code being run. If an error occurs in running a syntactically correct expression, execution will stop and the rest of the expression will not be executed. Anything assigned into the workspace by code that has been run will be kept (just as from the command line). traceback() does not work on expressions evaluted by parseEvalPrint(String).

Parameters:
expr - expression to parse, eval and show
Returns:
REXP result of the evaluation. Also printed to the console if visible. Returns null if there was an exception generated whilst evaluating the expression.

parseEvalTry

public REXP parseEvalTry(File file)
                  throws IOException
Parse and evaluate a text file in R. Calls parseEvalTry(File). Throws exception if problem reading the file.

Parameters:
file - text file to evaluate in R
Returns:
REXP result of the evaluation.
Throws:
IOException - if file cannot be read or problem during evaluation. See parseEvalTry(String).

true if R engine has been loaded/initialized.

assign

public void assign(String name,
                   REXP rexp)
            throws RFaceException
Create an R expression in R as an object so it can be referenced (in the global environment). Uses the rosuda engine assign function. NB: this assign does not use dispatch assignment methods, so it cannot be used to set elements of vectors, lists, names, attributes, etc. For these cases use assign(String, String) instead.

Parameters:
name - symbol name
rexp - r expression
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem assigning

assign

public void assign(String x,
                   String value)
            throws RFaceException
Assign a source expression to a variable using the assignment operator <-. Can be used to set elements of vectors, lists, names, attributes, etc.

Parameters:
x - destination variable name
value - source expression
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem assigning

                     throws RFaceException
Create an RList in R as a dataframe.

Parameters:
name - the name of the dataframe to create in R.
rlist - the rlist
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem assigning list

assignMatrix

public void assignMatrix(String name,
                         RList rlist)
                  throws RFaceException
Create an RList in R as a matrix. All elements of rlist must be of the same type and length.

Parameters:
name - the name of the dataframe to create in R.
rlist - the rlist
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem assigning list

loadFile

              throws IOException
Evaluate the contents of a file in R using the source() function.

Parameters:
file - file containing R commands
Throws:
IOException - if problem getting file path, or problem evaluating file

loadFileIntoEnv

public void loadFileIntoEnv(File file,
                            String environmentName)
                     throws IOException
Creates an new named environment and attaches it, then evaluates the contents of a file in R in that environment using the sys.source() function.

Parameters:
file - file containing R commands
environmentName - name of the environment in which to evaluate the source file, or null to evaluate the source file in the global environment
Throws:
IOException - if problem getting file path, or problem evaluating file

             throws RFaceException

working directory
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem getting directory

           throws RFaceException
Set the working directory. NB: this sets the working directory in not just R, but the java application environment.

Parameters:
dir - working directory
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem setting directory
